lines.text: You say the Loch Ness Monster is living in your jacuzzi?
[rolls eyes]
Well, call Roto-Rooter!
Just call Daffy Duck, Bugs Bunny and Porky Pig, paranormalists at large. Spooks spooked, goblins gobbled, UFOs K.O.ed, aliens alienated, vampires evaporated, and monsters remonstrated.

[to Porky]
Head on down to the Superstitious Mountains, and do some more snooping.

[to Sylvester]
What's the matter with you? What are you? A schizophre... a schizodephre... a-a manic depressive or something?
Well I'm here, what've I missed? Massacre started yet? Fireworks going off? Balloon going up?
Well what do ya know! He melted. He really was a snowman!
Abominable, that is.
And I searched and I searched... hooo it's hot... but I never caught up with my little bunny rabbit.
Jee, that's tough Mr. Abominabuble.
And now I'll never... gosh, it's hot... never see my bunny rabbit again.
Don't give up hope yet, doc. If you love him, he'll come back.
Oh Bugsy! Bugsy buddy!
Oh hi, uh, what's up, Duck?
Come here old pal, hm?

[picks up Bugs Bunny]
My OWN little bunny rabbit, d'oy.
Hey! An abominabuble snowman!
I will name him George, and I will hug him, and pet him...
Oh sure, I know I'm a louse, but I'm a live louse.
And I will give him security! And I will keep him warm like a mother hen, so he will never feel rejected or lack for love.

Poor old Bugs. But, anyway you look at it, it's better HE should suffer. After all, it was me or him, and obviously it couldn't be me. It's a simple matter of logic. I'm not like other people, I can't stand pain, it hurts me.

[trying to sell a car]
Right this way, folks, right this way! It's a bargain! Step right up and get yourself a brand new Dolorian! No household should be without one! Just $60,000 in three easy weekly installments. Yes sir, these little babies are selling like hotcakes! Plus, there's a free gift pack of ice-cold Billy Beer with each and ever purchase!

[answers door]
Yeeeessss?
Your troubles are over, Jeeves! Leave me to your stricken master.
Be gone!
Can't go in, huh?
Eeh, no.
Ohwell, no hard feelings, shake.
[shocks Butler with hand buzzer, squirts him with flower, hits him in the face with a cigarette box, and tickles him]

[laughing]
Oh oh, you can see him, you can see him! Right this way.

[after Sylvester wrestles a stuffed moose that's trying to shoot Porky Pig]
Sy-sy-sylvester! What are you trying to do, wake everybody in the house? Of all the screwball ideas. Fighting with stuffed animals.

It all adds up. You and the upstairs maid, 'do the old boy in' you said, 'elderberry wine and old lace' you said, 'then, the quick getaway' you said. Champagne nights, tropical music and a heavy bank account!
No no!
Yes yes! But you weren't clever enough, were you John, alias Johnny, alias Jack, alias Jackie? Whew! What's Humphrey Bogart got that I ain't got?

[sees a bat, mistaking it for another big mosquito]
Another one?
[sprays it]
They ought to spray this place.
Alright, what's holdin' up the works. What's all the... the... huh.
[sees Abominable Snowman]
Aaahh!
D'oh! What a cute little pink bunny rabbit.
[picks up Daffy]
Just what I always wanted. My own little bunny rabbit! I will name him George, and I will hug him, and pet him, and squeeze him.
I'm not a bunny rabbit.
And pat him, and pet him, and...
You're hurting me... put me down, please.
And rub him, and caress him, and...
I AIN'T NO BUNNY RABBIT!
Not a bunny rabbit, George? Then how come you have long ears, how come?
Long ears? Ooh!
[laughs]
Those aren't ears, those are sleeves! So, now put me down, please, huh?
Oh George... you were naughty to pretend you was a bunny rabbit. I will punish you good. Bad old George!
Wh-wh-what now?
[Sylvester hides himself in Porky Pig's suitcase]
Brother, the things I have to put with, with an idiotic cat. It's just a little, teeny, harmless spider, you shameless craven, you.

[sees a vampire bat]
Golly, what big mosquitos they do have around here.
[gets a flyswatter]
Hold still you little devil,
[swats the bat]
there!
Ok Abom, here's your bunny rabbit.
D'oya... bunny rabbit... George?
Bunny rabbit, me?
Yes, you, Doc.
Ho ho, very funny, ha ha, very droll. Hey, shorty! What do you consider to be the distinguishing characteristics of a rabbit?
D'oy... distinguishing... character...
Yeah, yeah, what makes a rabbit look like a rabbit?
Why, d'uh, d'uh, long ears!
And whom around here has long ears?
[to Bugs]
Sorry to hafta do this to ya, bud.

[ties ears down around face]
Eh, don't give it a second thought.

[picks up Daffy]
Oh boy! Just what I always wanted! My own little bunny rabbit! I will...
They really do make a charming couple.
...and pet him, and squeeze him, and rub him, and stroke his bill, and rub his pretty feathers... Hey, wait a minute. Bunny rabbits don't have feathers and bills.
I know, I know.
[pointing at Bugs, who is tunneling away]
There's goes your bunny rabbit!
Hey, uh, George, wait!
[tunnels after Bugs]
Ho ho, look out, bunny rabbit! This I gotta see.
[tunnels after Bugs and Hugo]
I am a vampire.
Oh, yeah? Well, abracadabra, I'm an umpire.
[an umpire uniform appears on Bugs]
Hocus-pocus!
[turns into a bat]
I'm a bat!
Okay, I'm a bat, too. Abracadabra!
[turns into a baseball bat]

[puts glasses on]
You wouldn't hit a bat with glasses on, would you?
[Bugs as the baseball bat hits the bat on the head]
Ou-yay upid-stay erk-jay!
[Pig Latin for "You stupid jerk"]
And I thought French was a romantic language!
Mary had a little lamb...
[turns into a demon]
But I *ate* it!

[escorting Bugs to a bedroom in the castle]
This is your room.
Yeah, sure, Doc, but I don't want a room, I just want a telephone.

[putting Bugs to bed]
Rest first; telephone tomorrow. Rest is good for the blood.

[yawns]
Well, I am a little "fati-gued".
